channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Bringing Thanksgiving food on a plane? Here is what you should know
item.description: Thanksgiving favorites such as mac and cheese, turkey and casseroles can be brought through TSA checkpoints. But cranberry sauce, maple syrup and gravy must go in checked baggage, the agency says.
item.content:encoded:
Thanksgiving favorites such as mac and cheese, turkey and casseroles can be brought through TSA checkpoints. But cranberry sauce, maple syrup and gravy must go in checked baggage, the agency says.

(Image credit: Transportation Security Administration)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: South Africa's illegal gold miners are locked in an underground standoff with police
item.description: Surviving on a diet of toothpaste and toilet paper, South Africa's notorious "zama-zama" illegal miners continue a weeks-long standoff with police in the darkness of a disused gold mine.
item.content:encoded:
Surviving on a diet of toothpaste and toilet paper, South Africa's notorious "zama-zama" illegal miners continue a weeks-long standoff with police in the darkness of a disused gold mine.

(Image credit: Shiraaz Mohamed)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: Trump's deportation vow alarms Texas construction industry
item.description: Texas builders warn mass deportations of undocumented migrants could devastate the construction industry, threatening housing and infrastructure work in one of the nation's fastest-growing states.
item.content:encoded:
Texas builders warn mass deportations of undocumented migrants could devastate the construction industry, threatening housing and infrastructure work in one of the nation's fastest-growing states.

(Image credit: John Moore)
item.dc:creator: Julian Aguilar

item.title: At least 11 killed in Israeli strikes in Beirut as diplomats push for cease-fire
item.description: The strikes were the fourth on Beirut in less than a week. The escalation comes after a U.S. envoy traveled to the region this week in an attempt to broker a cease-fire between Israel and Hezbollah.
item.content:encoded:
The strikes were the fourth on Beirut in less than a week. The escalation comes after a U.S. envoy traveled to the region this week in an attempt to broker a cease-fire between Israel and Hezbollah.

(Image credit: Hassan Ammar)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Atmospheric rivers aren't new. Why does it feel like we're hearing about them more?
item.description: In recent years, "atmospheric river" has become used much more frequently in scientific papers and in media coverage. According to experts who study climate and weather, a few reasons may explain why.
item.content:encoded:
In recent years, "atmospheric river" has become used much more frequently in scientific papers and in media coverage. According to experts who study climate and weather, a few reasons may explain why.

(Image credit: Mario Tama/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Venton

item.title: NATO and Ukraine to hold emergency talks after Russia's attack with new missile
item.description: NATO and Ukraine will hold emergency talks Tuesday after Russia attacked the city of Dnipro with an experimental, hypersonic ballistic missile that escalated the nearly 33-month-old war.
item.content:encoded:
NATO and Ukraine will hold emergency talks Tuesday after Russia attacked the city of Dnipro with an experimental, hypersonic ballistic missile that escalated the nearly 33-month-old war.

(Image credit: Vyacheslav Prokofyev/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What to know about Trump's picks for CDC, FDA and surgeon general
item.description: In a flurry of picks on Friday evening, Trump named three choices for top health jobs. Together they would help the incoming president shift the priorities of agencies that are key to public health.
item.content:encoded:
In a flurry of picks on Friday evening, Trump named three choices for top health jobs. Together they would help the incoming president shift the priorities of agencies that are key to public health.

(Image credit: Chris Unger)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: Storm lashes Northern California after leaving thousands without power in Seattle
item.description: The storm arrived in the Pacific Northwest earlier this week, killing two people and knocking out power to hundreds of thousands, mostly in the Seattle area, before moving through Northern California.
item.content:encoded:
The storm arrived in the Pacific Northwest earlier this week, killing two people and knocking out power to hundreds of thousands, mostly in the Seattle area, before moving through Northern California.

(Image credit: Noah Berger)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Florida health official advises communities to stop adding fluoride to drinking water
item.description: Florida's surgeon general, Dr. Joseph Ladapo, cited developmental concerns from higher levels of fluoride than are found in most U.S. water supplies.
item.content:encoded:
Florida's surgeon general, Dr. Joseph Ladapo, cited developmental concerns from higher levels of fluoride than are found in most U.S. water supplies.

(Image credit: Chris O'Meara/AP)
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Colombini

item.title: A 'lynch mob' did not come for Matt Gaetz, but the phrasing remains powerful
item.description: Even as a young child, I could understand the idea that words have meaning, which is why when Sen. Lindsey Graham referred to a "lynch mob" coming after Matt Gaetz, I felt my stomach drop.
item.content:encoded:
Even as a young child, I could understand the idea that words have meaning, which is why when Sen. Lindsey Graham referred to a "lynch mob" coming after Matt Gaetz, I felt my stomach drop.

(Image credit: Allison Bailey)
item.dc:creator: Leah Donnella
